title: Netanyahu Will Extend Israeli Sovereignty Over West Bank If Re-Elected
summary: Prime minister's push to cement control over settlements would upend decades of Israel's policy. TEL AVIV-Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he would extend Israeli sovereignty over parts of the West Bank if re-elected on Tuesday, a major policy shift that would stir Arab opposition and test President Trump's push for regional peace.

title: Tempers Fray, Tensions Rise Over Brazil's Pension Reforms
summary: Ministers trade insults over the new government's proposals for economic change. BRASÍLIA-It was meant to be a congressional debate about Brazil's most important economic reform in recent history. It resembled a drunken barroom brawl.

title: New City Rat Controls Put a Chill on Population Growth
summary: Impenetrable garbage cans and dry ice smoking rodents out of burrows are helping reduce complaints, but warm winter hurt efforts. New York City's $32 million effort to reduce its rat population includes cutting down their food supply with impenetrable garbage cans and smoking them out of their burrows with dry ice.

title: Low Storage, Prices Equal Bad News for U.S. Gas Producers
summary: Natural gas prices reflect scant concern about filling storage at lowest level in years, which won't lift barely-profitable producers. A trillion certainly sounds like a lot.

title: What Is the Best Temperature for Drinking Beer?
summary: Two experts share the ideal temperatures for serving different kinds of beer, from India Pale Ales to Guinness stouts.

title: Forget the Hotshot Trainer With the Six-Pack, Boomers Want Mature Fitness Coaches
summary: As older people hit the gym in record numbers, demand rises for trainers in their 50s and 60s; 'It's hard for someone who's young to understand'. After dieting and losing more than 30 pounds, Lynne Ranieri hired a personal trainer to help her exercise properly and keep off the weight. But there was a catch. "I did not want a perky, 20-something in Spandex telling this 60-something year-old body to do things it shouldn't-or couldn't-be doing," Ms. Ranieri says.

title: Cliff Diving at Blue Apron
summary: Blue Apron is the most recent example of the 'Glass Cliff' phenomenon in business-and it's a precarious one at best. Blue Apron's getting a new leader and she isn't afraid of heights.

title: A Coaching Nomad Crashes the Final Four
summary: In a short time, Chris Beard has conquered nearly every level of college basketball. His Texas Tech team is now two wins from a national championship.. MINNEAPOLIS-Chris Beard used to coach the best team in his league: the Warriors.

title: Russia and China Target Middle East Arms Deals
summary: The shift in a major defense market long dominated by U.S. and European companies sparks concern in Washington over sales and security. ABU DHABI-Russia and China are stepping up their efforts to woo Persian Gulf arms buyers, encroaching on a market long dominated by the U.S. and Europe and raising security concerns in Washington.

title: Nerf Is Getting Blasted From Below
summary: Hasbro developing cheaper toy guns, 'Fortnite'-inspired weapons as budget competitors strain brand's grip on market. Nerf's rivals have found its weak spot by aiming low.

title: 'Huma Bhabha: They Live' Review: Spooky Sci-Fi Sculpture
summary: An exhibition in Boston features delightfully unsettling works with a sci-fi existentialist downer vibe..

title: A Breathtaking Underwater Fitness Routine
summary: Resume Subscription. Frédéric Panaiotis may be head winemaker of Ruinart Champagne house, but when he wants to relax after the stress of harvest, he doesn't do it with bubbly. He does it by swimming deep into the sea on a single breath of air.

title: An Investigator, a Financial-Adviser 'Heir' and an Elderly Client: How Lines Get Blurred in Insurance Regulation
summary: Maryland Insurance Administration official was overruled then fired after recommending barring financial adviser. A state investigator concluded a financial adviser acted unethically and violated Maryland insurance laws when he received a windfall from an elderly client's estate. An arbitration panel then blasted the adviser's firm for what it called seriously deficient supervision. The firm also wasn't qualified to operate in the state at the time.

title: Texas Relief Money Caught in Trump Dispute With Puerto Rico
summary: State officials demand more than $4 billion of delayed hurricane-mitigation funds as storm season approaches. HOUSTON-Texas lawmakers are up in arms over more than $4 billion in federal aid for hurricane protection that has been delayed amid tensions between the Trump administration and Puerto Rico.

title: Photos: Scenes From the Deep End
summary: When this French winemaker passes through Brussels on business, he makes sure to practice freediving at the one of the world's deepest indoor diving pools. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: North Korean Dictator Seeks Russian Strongman for Support, Friendship
summary: Resume Subscription. SEOUL-With little progress to show from two nuclear summits with the U.S., North Korea is turning to an old friend-Moscow-as leader Kim Jong Un tries to chart a course toward winning relief from sanctions and economic isolation.

title: The Battle for the Last Unconquered Screen-The One in Your Car
summary: Auto makers and Silicon Valley are locked in a fight to control the dashboard display. The auto industry and Silicon Valley are locked in a battle for control of one of the last unconquered screens: your car dashboard display.

title: The Secret Trust Scores Companies Use to Judge Us All
summary: In the world of online transactions, trust scores are the new credit scores-but good luck finding out yours. When you're logging in to a Starbucks account, booking an Airbnb or making a reservation on OpenTable, loads of information about you is crunched instantly into a single score, then evaluated along with other personal data to determine if you're a malicious bot or potentially risky human.

title: Music Deals for Bytedance's TikTok and Douyin Are Close to Expiring
summary: The company and music labels are said to be far apart on terms for renewals. One of China's most valuable startups, which uses pop music for its flagship video app, could soon be in a tight spot as its licensing deals with music companies start expiring later this month, according to people with knowledge of the talks.

title: Bright Horizons Tests Parents' Patience, Not Nerves
summary: Day-care giant's app is a work in progress, but it performs background checks and employs its own caregivers. For many things, apps are great. For others, you might want to pick up the phone.

title: Starboard Walks Away from Dollar Tree Fight
summary: Activist investor was seeking control of retailer's board. Starboard Value LP has dropped a planned proxy fight at Dollar Tree Inc. after the retailer showed openness to implementing some of the changes the hedge fund sought.

title: U.S., China Tout Progress, Vow to Continue Trade Talks
summary: White House cautions that 'significant work remains'. Trade talks between Chinese and U.S. negotiators wrapped up in Washington with no clear timeline for resolution, but with both sides touting progress and vowing to continue talking via videoconference.
